  physical_appearance: This is a black-and-white photograph. It is rectangular in shape and portrait in orientation. It features two bearded men
 sitting on chairs in front of a tree. They are both wearing turbans
 and dressed in light-coloured shirt and trousers. They are both smiling and looking towards the camera. The background of the photograph is dark. There are no inscriptions on the photograph. There are no tears or folds seen.

  subject_terms_1: men (male humans) double portraits snapshots

 Group Men

  subject_terms_4: 

  sgcool_label_text: This is a personal photograph album that belonged to a Corporal A. Silver who spent 16 months in Singapore between 1951 and 1952. Silver was presumably a Jewish lady who was stationed in Singapore to serve at the Royal Air Force (RAF) Hospital at Changi. The album contains photographs that document her working and personal life
 including friends she made within the Jewish community in Singapore.

metadata.title_text: "Personal photograph album titled ""Sixteen Months in Singapore""" Sixteen Months in Singapore: Photograph of two men in turbans sitting
metadata.physical_appearance: This is a black-and-white photograph. It is rectangular in shape and portrait in orientation. It features two bearded men, sitting on chairs in front of a tree. They are both wearing turbans, and dressed in light-coloured shirt and trousers. They are both smiling and looking towards the camera. The background of the photograph is dark. There are no inscriptions on the photograph. There are no tears or folds seen.
metadata.sgcool_label_text: This is a personal photograph album that belonged to a Corporal A. Silver who spent 16 months in Singapore between 1951 and 1952. Silver was presumably a Jewish lady who was stationed in Singapore to serve at the Royal Air Force (RAF) Hospital at Changi. The album contains photographs that document her working and personal life, including friends she made within the Jewish community in Singapore.
